intro: Micranthes pensylvanica var. crassicarpa, commonly known as the Pennsylvania micranthus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly referred to as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
